headline.main: Program Teaches Girls Fitness and Good Health Habits

docs.abstract: Article describes combination aerobics, nutrition and stress management classes conducted by teacher Amy Barone to teenage girls at Sleepy Hollow High School in Sleepy Hollow, NY; photo (M)
docs.section_name: Education; Health; New York and Region
docs.lead_paragraph: WORKING out to the rhythms of UB40 and Puff Daddy, the teen-age girls could have been at a fitness club or in a music video. But instead they were in Amy Barone's gym class at Sleepy Hollow High School here. Ms. Barone leads some of her physical education classes in a new program called Physical Activities and Teen-age Health, which began last year. The program aims to reduce the risk of heart disease in minority youths and instill lifelong good health habits. Ninety of the high school's 250 girls took part last year.
